physical_appearance:This is a white kebaya voile with machine embroidered flower designs along its hem and edges. It has a tapered end
 and is a piece that is worn in a loose
 open jacket fashion.
subject_terms_1:flower (motif)  foliage (motif)  womenswear  Sino-Japanese War
 1937-1945 folk costume
subject_terms_2:Straits Settlements  Floral decorations  Foliation (Architecture and design)  Peranakan embroidery  Sino-Japanese War
 1937-1945 Ethnic costume
subject_terms_3:Textile art and design  1942-1945 Japanese occupation Peranakan costumes
sgcool_label_text:This white kebaya has a faint white pattern of flowers and foliage on the cloth
 and a white machine-made embroidered flower motif around its borders. The kebaya is a loose open jacket usually worn by Peranakan women of the Straits Settlements
 Indonesia and Indo-European women of the late 19th to 20th century. It has embroidered edges that imitate the look of lace
 which became popular during the mid-twentieth century and replaced lace as the decoration of choice along the border of the blouses. Its tapered ends was also popular during this time period. This kebaya belonged to a Chinese woman who was living in Java during the Japanese Occupation. She took on Peranakan dress and identity to adopt as low a profile  as possible in order not to attract attention

metadata.sgcool_label_text: This white kebaya has a faint white pattern of flowers and foliage on the cloth, and a white machine-made embroidered flower motif around its borders. The kebaya is a loose open jacket usually worn by Peranakan women of the Straits Settlements, Indonesia and Indo-European women of the late 19th to 20th century. It has embroidered edges that imitate the look of lace, which became popular during the mid-twentieth century and replaced lace as the decoration of choice along the border of the blouses. Its tapered ends was also popular during this time period. This kebaya belonged to a Chinese woman who was living in Java during the Japanese Occupation. She took on Peranakan dress and identity to adopt as low a profile  as possible in order not to attract attention
